column4: There‚Äôs still work to do to dig out from under #COVID19, but the US Q3 #GDP report is great news for our recovering economy and @realdonaldtrump‚Äôs pro-growth economic policies.

Great to visit today with the Meridian Rotary Club about the great things going on in this city and Lauderdale County, and how we can continue to work together. Thanks for terrific hospitality! @visitmeridian https://t.co/f5VKoREDuY

Honored to be designated a @nfib "Guardian of Small Business." Small business owners and those they employ have my admiration and solid support, especially as we work to overcome the #COVID19 pandemic. @nfib_ms

The Senate Dems have racked up a perfect four-for-four record of stopping the delivery of new #COVID19 relief. Unfortunately, their perfect record denies the citizens of MS and this great country a new round of PPP, unemployment benefits, money for vaccines and testing, and more.

PPP successfully kept hard-hit small businesses and their employees afloat as the #coronavirus battered our economy.  It‚Äôs a shame that Senate Dems continue to hurt the American people instead of getting real help out the door right now.

The ‚Äúall-or-nothing‚Äù act Speaker Pelosi and Senate Dems have clung to has only hurt Americans. The Minority Leader tried to adjourn the Senate last night sans any #COVID19 relief. We‚Äôre back in D.C. to get things done. We are here to offer actual help to Mississippians. https://t.co/4TmQkua3b6

Through the #pandemic, thousands protest with no problems from the DC mayor‚Äôs office, yet the mayor and city deny Capitol Hill Baptist Church applications to hold outdoor worship services. Pleased to join @SenatorWicker to fight this blatant violation of @chbcdc #religiousfreedom

#DYK, Mississippi sadly leads the nation in fire-related casualties? On #FirePreventionWeek, help yourself, #firefighters and #FirstResponders by testing smoke detector batteries. If you don‚Äôt have a detector, it‚Äôs time to get one! @MSFireAcademy @MSInsuranceDept

MS receives $3.5M in @USDA distance learning & #telemedicine grants for greater access to healthcare and educational resources in rural MS through @deltahealthcent @GLHnetwork @_TigerNation @CopiahLincolnCC & Pearl River School Dist. @RD_Mississippi @SecretarySonny

In our nation‚Äôs capital, mass protests are allowed, but church gatherings over 100 people are not. I joined @SenatorWicker legal brief arguing DC‚Äôs discrimination against houses of worship violates the 1st Amendment #ReligiousFreedom rights of @chbcdc worshipers.

We must work together on #COVID19 relief. Defunding the police & rewriting election laws have zilch to do w/ the current crisis. Re-upping #PPP, aid to help schools reopen safely, & increased treatment/vaccine resources, on the other hand, have lots to do w/ helping Americans.

Fisheries surveys, critical to @msgulfcoast economies, were suspended this year due to #COVID19. @NOAA should take action now to ensure the surveys can take place in 2021, so MS coastal communities can get this industry back on track. @SenatorRogerWicker
Learn more about the benefits of the #fluvaccine from the @CDCgov.  https://t.co/FALOvG8M1b https://t.co/KYvg4FK5X4

Getting a flu shot is important every year, but it‚Äôs especially important this year with #COVID19. Got my flu shot at @Walgreens this morning, and I hope my fellow Mississippians will do their part to protect themselves & their communities by getting vaccinated against the #flu.

Like so many in MS and across the USA and world, I am praying for a swift recovery for @realdonaldtrump and @FLOTUS as they fight #COVID19. The American people stand strong with you. May God continue to bless you and everyone affected by the #coronavirus. https://t.co/Wahzd9wNZd

I cast my vote for the Protect Act, which would‚Äôve assured people with pre-existing conditions aren‚Äôt denied health care/charged more for care. It‚Äôs a shame that progress is thwarted by partisan games that, interestingly enough, always reach a fevered pitch every other October.ü§î

I'm #AllInForChildrens!#MaskUpMS 

@childrensofms @Sanderson_Champ https://t.co/FJeSaAFNzx

Last night the Senate passed & @realdonaldtrump signed a stopgap funding bill to maintain fed. programs w/out disruptions as families & communities work through #COVID19. Hopeful the bipartisan cooperation that went into this will keep for negotiations in FY21 approps bills.
RT @FRCdc: .@senHydeSmith on why Republicans should fill the U.S. Supreme Court vacancy. https://t.co/YDhvg82XfX

Particularly during our current economic hardships due to #COVID19, it‚Äôs important to find ways to tear down roadblocks that keep women and minorities from reentering the #STEM workforce. Read more about @SenJackyRosen‚Äôs and my bill to address that:

.@SenateGOP offered 2 #COVID19 relief bills over the past 2 months, both blocked by Democrats. Time lost while they could have worked with us to boost healthcare, aid the jobless & help schools open safely. Looks like now they are starting to see consequences of their inaction.

Yesterday I asked the Senate to pass my SAVE Moms and Babies Act by unanimous consent. Democrats blocked it. @US_FDA should uphold rules put in place 20 yrs ago to protect the health of women using mifepristone. #AbortionPillKills https://t.co/XqOmYpIqbm

Was great chatting with @msbankers this morning. So disappointing Democrats in Congress continue to hold up new #COVID19 relief, including more #PPP to help #SmallBusinesses and save jobs. We‚Äôll keep working to get it done. https://t.co/MpYF9sNjhB

MS businesses are beginning to bounce back from #COVID19 downturn, much the same way we grew under @HaleyBarbour's leadership after Katrina. Former Gov Barbour shared insights with Senators today at @RoyBlunt‚Äôs Coffee and Conversation. Good stuff! https://t.co/gXavVpWivD

After MS veterans told me about a lack of rapid #COVID19 testing at the Armed Forces Retirement Home in @CityofGulfport, I wrote to @DLAMIL requesting that be rectified. Grateful for the quick turn-around and pleased our veterans will benefit. Read more here:
Wishing everyone in the Jewish community a happy, healthy, and sweet New Year! #HappyRoshHashanah! #ShanaTovah https://t.co/sDwPUmUFJa

Farmers & ranchers have experienced depressed prices, catastrophic flooding, market disruptions & now #COVID19. With the end of the fiscal year fast approaching, we must ensure important @USDA ag/conservation programs do not come to a screeching halt on Oct. 1.
RT @NRHA_Advocacy: During yesterday‚Äôs @SenateApprops hearing, @CDCDirector responded to @SenHydeSmith‚Äôs question regarding how @CDCgov is a‚Ä¶

Access to healthcare is always more challenging in rural America. @HHSGov @CDCgov @DeptofDefense & other agencies working with states to plan for potential #COVID19vaccine distribution to rural America later this year.
My latest e-newsletter, which includes highlights of some of my work with Mississippians as we work our way through the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic:

President @realdonaldtrump‚Äôs Executive Order on Advancing American Kidney Health is encouraging, but @SenatorWicker @CongPalazzo @ReptTrentKelly @RepMichaelGuest & I want ensure new regulations to fully support kidney transplant programs. @UMMCnews @DonateLifeMS @nfk Read here:

Sickle Cell Disease affects too many Mississippians. I joined my colleagues in introducing a resolution designating September as #SickleCellAwarenessMonth. It is my hope this resolution will support more advancements in treating and finding a cure. @mssicklecell @msdh @SCDAAorg

There are many ways we can safely pay our respects to those who lost their lives on #September11 amidst #COVID19. Join @NLEOMF tomorrow on Facebook live to honor law enforcement officers who gave their lives that day. https://t.co/Kbh3jlk5gb https://t.co/8gqlDGWOID

Here we go again. Dems block a #COVID19 relief bill with *billions* for school safety, unemployment benefits, liability protection & much more. Why? They want to cling to their demands for cannabis research, checks for illegal immigrants & tax cuts for blue state millionaires. https://t.co/A6ZVfsmqju

Financial hardship caused by #COVID19 puts some at risk of homelessness, which could mean greater risk of spreading #coronavirus. @HUDgov sending $18.7M in additional #CARESAct CDBG funding to help address housing & other hardships caused by the pandemic.

In addition to providing for kids, jobs, and healthcare, this plan would also provide $20B of additional farm assistance and $500M in direct federal assistance for fisheries, which would be crucial for MS farmers, fishers, and producers as they continue to navigate #COVID19.

This latest package provides help for:
‚úÖ Schools 
‚úÖUnemployment benefits
‚úÖTesting 
‚úÖSmall businesses 
But we can‚Äôt get Americans that help without a bipartisan agreement. No matter the party, it‚Äôs past time to get Americans and Mississippians the help they require.

üìà10.6 M jobs gained since April, bringing back ~50% jobs lost from #lockdown

üìâAugust unemployment drop is the 2nd largest decrease on record

üìâunemployment rate has already fallen below the peak unemployment from the great recession of 10%.

To protect vulnerable women and children, I joined @SenatorWicker @SenTedCruz & others to urge @US_FDA to classify mifepristone an ‚Äòimminent hazard to the public health‚Äô & remove it from the market. #ProLife  @SBAList @nrlc Read more: https://t.co/UYeY2Z8LUk

When the aviation industry returns to pre- #COVID19 levels, the need for pilots and technicians will be in even more demand. The @FAANews pilot education and aviation technician programs received full funding in FY20. It‚Äôs time to be proactive and implement them.

Great news for @PascagoulaCity @msgulfcoast: Just under $8M in #CARESAct funding to the MS Coast Transit Authority for transit services in Jackson County throughout #COVID19. Workers and residents rely on this transportation & I‚Äôm grateful it will continue to be provided for them

Great news: Just this morning, @TVAnews Board approved a special $200M #Pandemic Relief Credit to help communities recover economically. Wonderful to see TVA using its resources to deliver continued support for Mississippians & other customers throughout #COVID19. Read more:

#VaccinesWork & every child deserves a #ShotAtLife. Thank you to the health workers, traditional/religious leaders, @Rotary volunteers & @ShotAtLife advocates that worked to immunize millions of children & eradicate wild polio from all 47 countries in the Africa region. #EndPolio https://t.co/mGl5mcIAmW

Thank you @CMSgov @SeemaCMS  and @realdonaldtrump for this new #RuralCrosswalk. This added flexibility will be a huge help to rural healthcare providers in the fight against #COVID19, and your continued support goes a long way for Mississippi. https://t.co/nsA4s8rAyS.

ICYMI: Baptist Memorial Hospital‚ÄìNorth Mississippi & @UMMCNews to receive $1M to expand rural access to care in MS. UMMC will improve rural tele-emergency services & Baptist Memorial will continue developing a residency program, bringing needed doctors to rural regions. @HHSGov

Children will continue to need federal nutrition support whether their schools are open or offering online courses. @USDA has adapted child nutrition policies to meet the need, and that flexibility should continue as we work our way through #COVID19. @SecretarySonny @SenateAgGOP

$7.6M going to @MDEQ to support oyster hatchery/research center construction at @southernmiss‚Äôs GLCR. A healthy ecosystem for cultivating oyster reefs will mean both economic and environmental benefits for the @msgulfcoast. Exciting news for Mississippi!

.@USDA will make farm-raised catfish producers eligible for direct relief for losses associated with #COVID19. This is great news for MS catfish producers who have suffered declining sales because of #coronavirus. Grateful to @SecretarySonny for addressing this need. @usdafsa

$3.5M going to 10 MS universities/community colleges for student support services. @usedgov funding will help students stay on top of their studies, which will be especially important as #COVID19 affects campus life for the foreseeable future. @MSPublicUniv
In every of corner our state, Mississippians are heroically showing up to aid their neighbors during this #pandemic. Had a chance to thank our #COVID19 heroes today.

For the first time, @USDA is purchasing MS-produced shrimp to distribute to food banks and nonprofits, addressing some #COVID19 economic challenges. Grateful to @SecSonny for recognizing how this purchase decision will help an important @msgulfcoast industry & those in need.

Thank you, @realDonaldTrump for your commitment to telehealth expansion with this latest Executive Order.  It‚Äôs time for Congress to do its part and pass the #CONNECTforHealthAct. @UMMCTelehealth https://t.co/JkDvqaUJFg

I mask up for my family, my colleagues, and my fellow Mississippians. 

Who do you mask up for? @MSEMA @UMMCnews @MMLonline @billyhewes @MSManufacturers 

#MaskUpMS https://t.co/VNEE74caPm https://t.co/u0QMqnt87Q

Rural hospitals have been significantly affected by #COVID19. Let‚Äôs not put them in a position of having to choose between rural physician training programs or staying open. I joined in asking @HHSGov to release #coronavirus emergency funding to help them.

Happy #NationalInternDay to my small but dedicated summer intern class! #COVID19 made for an unusual summer session, but my staff and I were so appreciative of their good work. https://t.co/f0y9tQzzHL
Was wonderful to sit down with @usedgov @BetsyDeVosED to discuss how to best serve students and educators during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/l7O3QKO4UC

The #COVID19 trajectory indicates that MS frontline workers, first responders and citizens will need substantial and sustained supplies of PPE. $4.39M from @FEMA supports @msema‚Äôs disaster response efforts. @SenatorWicker

Great to see @nationalguardMS working with @msdh to process #COVID19 tests. The National Guard is playing an important role in providing manpower and support as our state works to overcome the #coronavirus. Watch here: https://t.co/vvfzHN0G8P

The HEALS Act represents a responsible, realistic plan to help schools, workers, the economy and, importantly, frontline caregivers. Americans want and need Congress to work together to continue the #COVID19 fight. More on the appropriations portion below:

Overcoming #COVID19 public health, economic and social challenges will take hard work. #CORPSAct will empower Americans to help make communities stronger & healthier for everyone. @AmeriCorps @NationalService

Mississippians can‚Äôt wait until Democrats decide to put the American people over politics. A #COVID19 vaccine & other medications can‚Äôt do any good when people can‚Äôt afford them. @ChuckGrassley‚Äôs Prescription Drug Pricing Reduction Act should be in the next relief package.

#COVID19 is without a doubt raising anxiety among Mississippians, which can create critical situations for those already dealing with mental health or substance abuse issues. The @HHSgov has awarded $1.3M to address these issues in to our state. @MSUExtService
#MaskUp https://t.co/RNyHWV4ps4

It‚Äôs an honor to be recognized as a 2020 #MedicareAdvantage Congressional Supporter by @BMAlliance. Affordable healthcare is more important than ever during the #COVID19 crisis, and I will continue to work hard to keep it that way. Learn more below:

https://t.co/8GpsakPMy5 https://t.co/wv7lZFIWXp

I joined @SenBillCassidy & others asking @HHSGov @CMSGov for details on sustaining expanded #telehealth even after #COVID19. It has proven too valuable to reduce access, especially for rural Mississippians. @UMMCTelehealth is a national leader. https://t.co/cQP7kfXZwB https://t.co/2pGry8vwqH

#COVID19 has only added to Mississippian‚Äôs anxieties around skyrocketing prescription drug prices. If we‚Äôre serious about helping Americans, @ChuckGrassley‚Äôs bill to address these issues should be an immediate priority.

#COVID19 increases in rural Mississippi and USA put greater hardships on providers. @Sen_JoeManchin & I continue to push @HHSgov for definite 20% set aside for rural providers. w/ @SenatorWicker @RepTrentKelly @RepMichaelGuest

.@FAANews  grants $15.56M to improve 22 MS airports, with #CARESAct funding added to help offset the #COVID19 financial hits to our cities and counties. @SenatorWicker  https://t.co/pJy2PANiKC https://t.co/K7YLKzj12K

With #coronavirus cases rising and the #July4th holiday here, it‚Äôs important we do our part to protect ourselves & fellow Mississippians. This @NIST video demonstrates how wearing a mask reduces the potential spread of #COVID19. Take a look. https://t.co/2vhxDkoZrp

Big Day for the #USA! #USMCA takes effect, bringing benefits for American manufacturers, farmers, businesses & workers. Builds on @realDonaldTrump's America first commitment & can help us build a stronger post-#COVID19 economy. https://t.co/486WmYapmq

Disappointed in the @Scotus decision striking down a Louisiana law requiring abortion clinics to have hospital admitting privileges, a ruling that also effectively negates a similar law in Mississippi. #ProLife @nrlc @SBAList

Appreciate @UMMCnews working to find good out of the bad associated with #COVID19. Let‚Äôs continue working to avoid new cases. But if you‚Äôve had the #coronavirus, learn more about how you might be able to help. @msdh #InThisTogether https://t.co/3OaIZMfQGr

A strong health workforce is more necessary than ever as #COVID19 is showing us.  The $1.27 in @HHSGov @HRSAgov funds going to @UMMCnews and @USMGoldenEagles will fortify these already very established programs.

#COVID19 is helping prove the benefits of telehealth services. We can‚Äôt allow #Medicare clawback demands to stunt progress. @SenAngusKing & I have introduced legislation to shield rural clinics & federally qualified health centers from those costs throughout the #pandemic. @msdh

National service programs have established strong records for providing critical assistance in times of crisis. That‚Äôs why I helped introduce the #CORPSAct, which would double the # of @AmeriCorps positions this year to help folks overcome hardships caused by #COVID19.
We must remain wary of #COVID19 as MS reopens. This @CDC Resuming Business Toolkit is useful in going about our business more safely. https://t.co/sMM4Xo8ToP
RT @CDCgov: Office building employers, building owners and managers, and building operations specialists can create a #COVID19 workplace he‚Ä¶

.@HHSGov awards $219M in #CARESAct funding to support MS safety net hospitals serving Medicare and other vulnerable patients. I will continue working to help these facilities remain open and survive the #COVID19 health crisis.

Critical Access Hospital designations can help many MS rural hospitals keep their doors open. I‚Äôm cosponsoring the Rural Hospital Closure Relief Act to give the @msdh more flexibility to approve CAH status and saving more hospitals.

More work to be done, but May #jobsreport offers a glimmer of hope for safely reopening MS & nation for business. Thankfully, our @realdonaldtrump economy was healthy before #COVID19, and we may bounce back faster than expected! https://t.co/cDVJ6c0Jlt

I‚Äôm cosponsoring the Save Rural Hospitals Act of 2020 to ensure fair Medicare payments for Mississippi‚Äôs hospitals. This is desperately needed in rural areas, where some hospitals face the risk of closing. @SenAlexander

Pro-abortion groups have filed a lawsuit to overturn longstanding @US_FDA policies protecting women and children‚Äôs health.  The Trump Administration must stand up for women by fighting this vigorously in court. https://t.co/xf40GgwNH8

#COVID19 exposed the risks of lacking a strong national critical medical supply stockpile. I‚Äôm cosponsoring legislation with @SenThomTillis @SenatorBennet to improve and renew the Strategic National Stockpile. Read more: https://t.co/eVNAsYq1c1

MS rural health providers need assured access to #COVID19 resources as the pandemic affects their ability to survive financially. @Sen_JoeManchin, @lisamurkowski & I have a bill to require 20 percent set-aside. Read more.

#COVID19 stress on state, county & city budgets is made worse for those hit by disasters. I‚Äôve introduced a bill to eliminate the @FEMA cost-share for 2020 federal disaster declarations. This plan builds on the #SMARTAct bill from earlier this week. @MSEMA

.@MSSeafood is a huge economic driver on the @msgulfcoast. Demand has dropped with #COVID19 shuttering restaurants. @SenatorWicker @CongPalazzo & I are asking @USDA @SecretarySonny to buy MS seafood to help sustain those in need.

I‚Äôm hearing from MS cities and counties about their hardships as #COVID19 costs pile up. A responsible, bipartisan $500B #SMARTFund bill would give cities, counties and states help to avoid mass layoffs and essential service lapses. @SenBillCassidy @SenatorMenendez
